alert.note: Alert for Dinwiddie; Prince George; Surry; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 3:08PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Prince George, northeastern Sussex, east central Dinwiddie and Surry Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 308 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cabin Point to near Carson. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Cabin Point and Burrowsville around 315 PM EDT. Claremont around 325 PM EDT. Sussex around 350 PM EDT. Dendron and Elberon around 355 PM EDT. Surry, Scotland and Homeville around 400 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Taylors Corner, Carsley, Newville, Booker, Reams, Spring Grove, Brandon, Barham, Templeton and Prince George Golf. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
